comment: This guy is straight to the point. He gives you tests, quizzes, a couple projects, and just a few homeworks. His class is easy if you do his in class examples. Additionally, he will go out of his way to help you if you have anything come up during the semester.

Professor Prasad was extremely knowledgeable in Solidworks as well as Simulations. He did a great job teaching us how to apply simulation results to real world applications and apply what we learned in Fluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer. Definitely take this Professor for CAE.

Very accessible and understanding. Laid out the course materials in a very easy, straightforward, and clear way. Made a challenging course material feel somewhat relaxed. Some instances of being tested on concepts before the homeworks on them were due. Maybe something came up for him that caused this scheduling, but it was odd nonetheless.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: By far one of the best professors I have taken in KSU. Professor Prasad is extremely knowledgeable in CAE and Solidworks, I would highly recommend taking him. He is also very willing to help his students and responds to e-mails usually within 24-48 hours.

I wasn't sure what I was walking into but Professor Ventrapragada was a very good teacher for the subject. The only thing that makes the class difficult is the implementation of previously learned Laplace transforms, which I personally didn't have a good foundation of, but Prasad even made that part of the class easy to understand. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He teaches a very well-structured computer aided engineering course. Starts with the basics in SolidWorks to teach how to properly run FEA simulations for one half of the semester, then Flow simulations in the second half. Seems very knowledgeable and experienced in the engineering field, and I enjoyed taking him.
